title.narrative: QUALITY SOCIAL WORK

description.narrative: Output 1.4: A quality assurance system over social work, including case management, gate-keeping and referral is functioning and aligns international standards., which contributes to Child Health, Child Protection Systems, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Health Systems Strengthening, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1: Families with children, adolescents, and young people living close to or below the national subsistence minimum are more resilient (to economic and social deprivation, and stress) and they benefit more from equitable access to quality and inclusive social services and transfers

participating-org.narrative: ACADEMY FOR PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION UNDER THE PRESIDENT OF THE RK
KAZAKH NATIONAL UNIVERSITY NAMED AF AL FARABI

sector.narrative: Protective services for children on the move
Provision of (formal and non-formal) secondary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.4: A quality assurance system over social work, including case management, gate-keeping and referral is functioning andaligns international standards.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the introduction of the social service workforce (SSWF) competencies for individual and community-based engagement into the curriculum of the pre- and in-service training providers and equipped them with relevant tools (basic SSWF competencies for behavior change, partnership with parents and individual child support plans for inclusion). | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/01/2021

Status of the incorporation into national legislation of an intersectoral normative framework forsocial work between the health, education and social protection systems benefitting vulnerable children and families(41788)

baseline.value: An intersectoral normative framework for social is not available

target.value: 2020:By 2020, normative framework for strengthening of intersectoral collaboration of social work between the health, education and social protection systems benefitting vulnerable children and families is incorporated into national legislation

actual.value: 2020:Draft Social Code, Law on the status of social worker, National Plan of social assistance provide for an intersectoral normative framework for social work between the health, education and social protection systems benefitting vulnerable children and fami

title.narrative: Availability of supervision and quality assurance mechanisms over case management, gate-keeping and referrals related to social work across the health, education, and social protection sectors benefitting vulnerable children and families(41790)

baseline.value: Inter-sectoral supervision and quality assurance mechanism do not exit

target.value: 2020:Supervision and quality assurance mechanisms over case management, gate-keeping and referrals in social work are introduced in health, education, and social protection sectors benefitting vulnerable children and families

actual.value: 2020:Draft Social Code, Law on the status of social worker, National Plan of social assistance provide for Supervision and quality assurance mechanisms over case management, gate-keeping and referrals in social work in social welfare

title.narrative: Status of the incorporation of standards for case management, gate-keeping and referral systems and related quality assurance mechanism in a national, sectoral normative framework for social work(41789)

baseline.value: Standards for case management, gate-keeping and referral systems and related quality assurance mechanism are not provided in current legislation (the Law On Specialised Social Services, the Law On Soc

target.value: 2020:Normative framework for social work sets out basis for case management, gate-keeping and referral systems and related quality assurance mechanism

actual.value: 2020:Draft Social Code, Law on the status of social worker, National Plan of social assistance provide for standards for case management, gate-keeping and referral systems and related quality assurance mechanism
